subject: Doping (Sports)
lead_paragraph: A California-based doctor who was indicted in April by federal authorities on charges he supplied patients, including professional baseball players, with performance-enhancing drugs, was indicted in Ohio on similar charges. The doctor, Ramon Scruggs, was indicted in Cuyahoga County on 13 counts of drug trafficking. The indictment said Scruggs prescribed steroids to a Cleveland police officer over the Internet for nonmedical purposes from 2003 to 2007.
